title: What manufactures the data packets? - Quora

response.answer_text: A data packet isn't a physical object, and such isn't really manufactured at all. But to answer the question, the device that starts the transmission of data will form the packet, simply by sending the bits down the wire in the appropriate order to meet the standards of a packet, at which point the receiving device (most likely a router of some sort) will receive them, interpret the data by following the same standard and pass the packet onto the next hop, which repeats until it gets to the destination.
Data packets are made at the IP and Transport Layer so Layer-2/3 makes it. There are different naming conventions and everyone will not agree with my above definition.
